TopicTitle: The new description system is so awesome.

Articles.Content:
Allow us to add some "lore" to our models

Here is the description of one of my aircraft:

An Experimental twin-engine aircraft made for Reconnaissance and Electronic aerial surveillance, designed for flying at high speeds and at high altitudes, the "Frost Troll" comes in the standard model with a state-of-the-art aerial surveillance system and top notch flying computer and gauges.

Control surfaces are commanded with an advanced fly-by-wire and the engines are thrust vectoring capable.

Please note: This aircraft is an experimental model and we don't take responsibility for any accident that may occur, as described in the purchase contract.

I know it's useless but it's kinda cool to add some deep info into your designs.

Do you add description to your models or do you just go straight for action with them?

I've started adding them once I realized they showed up when you selected a vehicle from the launchpad on the space center. I've added KSP-style tongue-in-cheek descriptions to all of my 0.21 creations so far.

What'd make my day, RP-wise, is a 'Kerbal Space Museum' building, where all successfully launched missions have small-scale models of them exhibited in a row, with name, description, date of launch and mission flag.

:3
It's very cool, i'd like it if Kerbals had a notes section too, "gets sick easily, best placed sitting a few meters away from the rest of crew) hehe
